snippet: The country will cut its 12.5 percent corporate tax rate in half for revenues pegged to patents and other intellectual property.

byline.contributor: Douglas Dalby reported from Dublin, and Mark Scott from Brussels.
byline.original: By DOUGLAS DALBY and MARK SCOTT

abstract: Irish government announces its already low corporate tax rate of 12.5 percent will be reduced by half for new category that will cover revenue generated for companies by patents and other intellectual property; move is likely to intensify criticism from other countries that Ireland offers friendly tax treatment to multinational giants.
lead_paragraph: The country will cut its 12.5 percent corporate tax rate in half for revenues pegged to patents and other intellectual property.

headline.print_headline: Even Lower Tax Rates are in StoreIn Ireland
headline.main: Ireland, Accused of Giving Tax Breaks to Multinationals, Plans an Even Lower Rate
